title: About
text:
Hello,
As you might have seen somewhere in this website, my name is Prasaath Sastha Kuppan Ravi. Please don‚Äôt hate me for that name, I understand it is quite a bit. You can remember me as Prasaath and this is how I look (on a good day, with perfect lighting and some photoshopüòÖ.
If there is anything worth knowing about me it is that I am just another invisible person whom you may have met on the tube yesterday. My point is, there is nothing special about me. Just another person who shares the same space as everyone else.
I made this website using Quarto and R. I have no idea how to build websites or make it look cool and interactive, but I am learning.

title: Prasaath Sastha Kuppan Ravi
text:
Relevant Coursework:

Molecular Cell Biology and Immunology: Focused learning on genetics of organisms, protein structure and function, DNA sequencing, molecular cloning, PCR and Recombinant DNA technology. GPA: 4.5
Lab skills: DNA extraction (Phenol chloroform method), Agar gel electrophoresis, SDS PAGE, Bradford assay, BCA assay, Nano star plate reader.
Translational Medical Sciences: Critical learning of novel approaches in target screening, lead optimisation, target validation and toxicity screening. Prepared and presented presentation on current prospects of Factor XI in Thromboembolic diseases. GPA: 4.5
Lab skills: MTT assay
Molecular Medicine: Problem based learning to approach disease pathology at a molecular level for modulation of therapeutic strategies. GPA: 4.25
PBL (Problem based learning): Bacteriophage based solution for management of prostate adenocarcinoma.
Contemporary topics in Drug Discovery and Toxicology: Evaluate the applications of pharmacological and toxicological methods in fundamental research and the pharmaceutical industry. Clinical trial development, ICH, GCP, and preclinical toxicology GPA: 4.25
Research Project: Detection of Semi-carbazide Sensitive Amine Oxidase in rat brown adipose tissue and investigating the effects of caffeine and simvastatin on SSAO enzyme kinetics. Supervised by Dr.¬†John Skamarauskas.
Lab skills: Lyophilization, protein extraction, Bradford assay, BCA assay, Amplex red assay, enzyme kinetics experiment.
To view the full project and the repository click here.

title: Prasaath Sastha Kuppan Ravi
text:
WORK EXPERIENCE

Quality Control Analyst

Eisai Manufacturing Limited (GMP Laboratory), Jun 2023 ‚Äì May 2024

Tested over 500 batches of packaging components (cartons, patient information leaflets, aluminium foils, and labels) using EyeC proofilers for artwork checks, and IR testing for material quality.
Analysed over 40 batches of bulk/finished/stability products - tablets, suspensions, and capsules in line with the market specifications and regulatory requirements. Analysis includes assay, relative substances or impurities, content uniformity, using HPLC (PDA/NonPDA), dissolution and UV.
Created workflow dashboards on Monday.com in stability sample management and reporting timelines. Worked with custom formulae to automate sample pull dates, testing requirements and analyst notifications as per the product stability protocol and supporting stability SOPs. Updated validated spreadsheets to calculate assay, related substances, and dissolution results to improve workflow and reporting results.




Research Assistant

Amura Health, Aug 2021 to Aug 2022

Researched to collect and compile evidence based clinical and non-clinical information relevant to disease of interest to support protocol development.
Created relational databases to optimise workflows of physicians and physician assistants and was responsible for their maintenance. Organised and planned collection of body weight data of 1100 clients to analyse and interpret protocol efficacy. Collaborated in making protocol efficacy presentation that showed the firm¬¥s protocols for obesity and diabetes management, which illustrated 60% supremacy.
Built and updated a clinical laboratory report analysis tool that improves the physicians¬¥ report evaluation workflow.

title: Prasaath Sastha Kuppan Ravi
text:
Hi,
I‚Äôm Prasaath! I recently graduated with a Master‚Äôs in Drug Discovery and Toxicology. Originally from India, I moved to the UK in 2022 for my studies, and these past two years have been an incredible journey.
üîùThis is how I look on a good day with perfect lighting and some Photoshop.

Education

MSc. Drug Discovery and Toxicology | University of Hertfordshire (2022 - 2024)
Doctor of Pharmacy | Vinayaka Missions Research Foundation (2015 - 2021)



Work Experience

Quality Control Analyst intern | Eisai Manufacturing Limited (2023-2024)
Research Assistant | Amura Health (2021-2022)

More information about my me can be found on this site and click here for my CV.
I‚Äôm always eager to learn and try new things‚Äîthat‚Äôs at the center of my approach toward anything life. My personal motto is a Latin phrase that resonated deeply with me, Aut inveniam viam aut faciam (I shall either find a way or make one), reflects that perfectly. When I‚Äôm not studying, working, or hitting the gym, you‚Äôll probably find me watching anime or catching up on TV series.
During my time working with Amura Health, I realized how much of a privilege good health really is. It‚Äôs something you have to actively work towards, and that‚Äôs why I stay mindful of what I eat and make staying active a priority.
Lately, I‚Äôve been diving into R for data analysis, which has opened the door to learning Quarto, Git, and GitHub (just out of curiosity and exploration). In fact, I built this page using Quarto and deployed it via GitHub Pages!
